The breakfast spread is nice, but the service was realllly slow. I found that everywhere we went in Amsterdam. It's not a service oriented culture. So, The Dylan's breakfast staff was just about as slow as the rest of the city's. Overall, If you're an older tourist type of person, this hip hotel is probably not for you anyway. It's expensive and has a bar and outdoor lounge where people can drink and smoke late at night. Which we loved. So, if you are a cosmopolitan couple like us, you'd love The Dylan.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced, Over Designed, Disapointment”
Reviews.Author: AndMat
Reviews.Content: What a disapointment this hotel is! There is so much more to a trendy boutique hotel than just a beautiful building and unfortunately this is the only thing going for the Dylan. Hotel staff were very dismissive, to the point of ignoring you when you are actually standing in the reception room. We had early check-in booked as we were on an early flight, however the room was not ready until almost 3pm, none of the staff offered an explaination or apologised for the inconvenience. Check-in to the room, only to have house keeping come in about 10min after arrival to re-stock the mini bar, explaining they had not had time to do it yet, but would do it now so we would not be charged for missing items. Unbelievable. The rooms whilst supposedly designer chic, are ridiculously over designed. We had the kimono/japanese inspired room which required you to bend over to see into the bathroom mirror, sit on your knees to have a shave, or use the small shaving mirror which was located on the adjacent wall, but the lighting cast a massive shadow which made this useless. The shower dribbled against the wall, so we got the maintenance person to put a new one in, only to find it was equally useless. The rooms have a table and chair at the end of the bed, or a couch, located directly under the plasma tv on the wall, again useless. Not really designer chic! We expressed our concerns to the hotel manager who advised we could not be moved on out first night, but he could change our room on the second. Not wanting the hassle we opted to stay in the existing room, and having spoken to other guests it sounds as though the other rooms are equally overdesigned, although we did not see them first hand. A really disapointing, overpriced hotel. Definately not worth the money. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Dylan”
Reviews.Author: Kluiten
Reviews.Content: I lived in Amsterdam for 4 years, so coming back is always special for me, particularly when I'm bringing a friend with me to impress them with my favourite city. I know WITHOUT QUESTION that service can be dreadful in Amsterdam, but I cannot criticise the service in The Dylan. Not only is it excellent (and helpful) but it made this particular 5 star make you feel as it should do - relaxed, pampered and valued. I have read the other reviews from guests who were 'concerned' about the size of the rooms, but the reality is you're staying in a beautifully restored property, so no, they're not going to be palatial in the standard size - this is the architecture of the period, but I challenge any guest to find a more beautifully renovated house on the main canals that offers the same quality. And service. I loved the 2 nights I just experienced - the service, the room, and the location - and would recommend that if you want to see Amsterdam at its best (it's in the Jordaan so the quality area is where you are), you need to book in. Remember old in Amsterdam sometimes means small, but the best presents . . . . . .

Reviews.Title: “A disaster”
Reviews.Author: tony10014
Reviews.Content: Our bedroom overlooked a courtyard where guests partied until 4:00 or 5:00 am. The windows were not double glazed, so we got no sleep. The hotel may be billed as a designer hotel, but little thought seemed to have gone into the bathrooms. Our shower delivered water vertically downwards onto the tiling at thee nd of the bath, and had no thermostat. With one hand holding the shower, and the other hand constantly adjusting the temperature to the varying water pressure, one needed to ask a friend to perform one's ablutions! The designer window blind disintegrated on use. Breakfast was an exorbitant E24 for a coffee, orange juice, and a few rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling from check-in to check-out”
Reviews.Author: David&Jane
Reviews.Content: This hotel bills itself as a deluxe hotel. The design is brilliant and totally impactical. Lights that do not work / baths taking 20 minutes to fill / service that is so amateur that you wonder where they get their staff. Room cleaned at 5.00 p.m. / staff walking into your room at 8.30 a.m. unanounced. The list is endless and more interestingly noone cared. If you want service then don't waste your time. Make sure that you don't leave your bags at reception as they stuck lables all over it that has left a permanent mark. From check in to check out a total disaster. Good value at 50 Euros not 400 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Noo36
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect at The Dylan after mixed reviews on this site, but we were not disappointed. The hotel was stylish and beautifully looked after, our rooms were a delight, and the staff were wonderful - everyone from the receptionist, to the conceirge, from the room service guys, to the restaurant staff, were friendly and could do not do enough to help. Every request was taken care of with perfect politeness and a smile. The restaurant at the hotel was excellent and we would recommend it. In room breakfasts were vast - way too much for a couple, but delicious. The hotel building is unusual and corridors are long and winding - but that's just a quirk of staying in an old building, and one we rather liked. We went with friends - our rooms were next to each other and they were totally different and unique in their own way - we prefer this to the blandness you can experience in some top hotels. We felt spoilt staying here which made for a very enjoyable, relaxed time in Amsterdam. We'd definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great, eccentric but click hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladbroke
Reviews.Content: I read one of the below reviews expecting the dylan to be past its prime after the changeover from ANoushka Hempel, shabby rooms, etc but was very pleasantly surprised. I went to amsterdam, a city i love and have visited many times for work and for pleasure, with a new partner - we were really surprised by the polite and professional (not at all snobby) service, great room service, great cocktails in the bar, and best of all, a great room. Booked a cheap (â‚¬230) rate off the internet and was expecting a broom closet, but the room was very nice, large (by Amsterdam standards), loads of character, clean, kept-up-looking, just very very cool. I'd not hesitate to recommend the dylan especially as there are not too many options in AMsterdam for characterful, stylish hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish property for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: Family-C-L
Reviews.Content: This is a chic and special property, converted from an antique Dutch bakery (I believe) so the architectural construction is unique. This allows for interesting rooms (we had a duplex suite), but also some inconveniences like you need to be no taller than 5 ft. to look into the bathroom mirror. But for us, it was a weekend stay for pleasure, so we dealt with it. The thing about Dutch service, and I preface the following sentence by saying that I'm totally generalizing and appropriating stereotypes (half of the staff is probably not Dutch, but even still...), the guest does not feel like s/he is a VIP, but rather a friend or an acquaintance. When we checked in, the concierge had no problems telling us that the property used to be the Blakes and since it became the Dylan, he has seen the quality of the guests drop (!). Well, I hope he wasn't refering to us....... smile Later on we borrowed hotel bicycles to tour the city. The staff volunteered to waive the rental charge without us asking (that was nice of them), but then when we came back, he said with a measure of scorn in his eyes: "oh you're back late." We felt like maybe we should have insited on paying the 15 euros! The location is excellent and we loved the breakfast (not included in the rate). The aforementioned casualness of the Dutch staff is a plus in another way since you feel very laid back and easy around them. In other words, if you like more formal service, then the Dylan is probably not for you. But if you want a place that is chic, good to people watch and admire old Dutch architecture, then it's a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the theiving staff!”
Reviews.Author: CarrieHooton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dylan for 3 nights. On the face of it - not bad at all. Nice little hotel, staff could have been bit more attentive but nice nonetheless. Our room was very well decorated although it was a little small and there was nowehere near enough room to hang clothes - bit of a problem when there are no ironing facilities. Hotel is very well located. We had a marvellous time, as we always do in Amsterdam. The hotel was very pricey but it was a treat so who cares. Sadly our stay was ruined when we left the hotel. I (stupidly) left a bag full of duty-free cosmetics in the bathroom cupboard. With hindsight thank christ it wasn't jewellery. We checked out mid-morning and left our bags ready for collection later that day. I realised I'd left my "goodies" and thought (as with every other half-way decent hotel) they would have been handed in by housekeeping. Not so! I explained what had happened to the staff and they really couldn't have cared less. There was no sincere apology and they didn't seen surprised or concerned at what I as saying. They couldn't wait to get rid of me as their new "victims" were checking in and hearing my complaint. No resolution was offered - nothing...and we had just spent a fortune at their hotel. I am disgusted and would NOT recommend this hotel to anybody. Absolutely shameful !!!!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels in europe”
Reviews.Author: tikvica
Reviews.Content: The Dylan was one of the best experiences I've had with the hotels in Europe. Very luxury car waited for us ont he airport, warm welcome at the reception. We got the perfect room on the first floor, with a canal view. Perfectly designed (Anoushka Hempel style, as all blake hotels), biggest and greatest bed I've ever slept on. Perfecty lit room. Didn't have air-con problems :) The staff is very well trained and pleasant - they all look good in very nice uniforms, they're always smiling - and the best thign is that you don't see'em most of the time, but the're always there. Even if you get out of you room for 15 minutes, when you come back you find everything clean and proper, and you don't get to see any of the staff. You can even find an eye-mask and anti-hangover stuff in the mini-bar. The restaurant and the food are perfect, very nice and big selection. Pricy, though, but that's the thing with all the good hotels. At least here you get really good stuff for your money.

Reviews.Title: “The Dylan (Watch Out)”
Reviews.Author: Bakesie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at the Dylan Hotel (formerly Blakes) and it was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. Maybe that is the reason why this property keeps changing ownership. Mark my words......do not even consider this hotel if you expect any comfort. The first night the room was visually appealing upon entering but were everything from the drapes to the sheets to the towels were dated and filthy. The room was completely unfunctional as well, shower was awful and nothing in the room worked properly. (and I mean nothing). The flooring was made of a material you could not walk on barefoot. It was 75 degrees outside but management felt it was not necessary to turn on the air conditioner in the rooms. My room was a complete sweat box and sweated thru the night. When I called the front desk to change rooms I was told there would be a $400.00 upgrade charge because the only room available that night available was a suite. The next morning I immediately went to change rooms for the next night and they put me in another room. This room again was decent upon first inspection but again had no air-conditioning. We were forced to leave the windows open for air and the mosquitoes were awful and kept us up all night biting us. It was worse than camping out. Once again, nothing in the rooms functioned properly and upon closer inspection of the stuff in the room, this new room was outdated, stuffy and overall of poor sanitary standards. The General Manager of the hotel was off on vacation and I still have not gotten any explanation or apology for this nightmare of a stay. You would figure after the first night of a miserable stay, management would have put me in a room that was somewhat comfortable. The staff could care less and I advise you all to stay away from this property. I also stayed in the American Hotel in Ledspelein and it was significantly better. The Dylan needs to be torn down and rebuilt from scratch if it wants to be thought of as a high end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a cool hotel... in any respect.”
Reviews.Author: SMMMMM
Reviews.Content: Given the rates and adverstising for this hotel one would at least expect basic luxuries like air conditioning. Do not be deceived. They will say that their rooms are air conditioned. Most are not! They have some sort of fan that blows, but no cool air. They twice put me in rooms that they claimed had air conditioning, only for me to find out that the staff had lied. Eventually they placed a portable unit in my room for one night and moved me to a room that was barely cooler the next night. Additional bizarre details include the fact that you need to be four feet tall to shave in the bathroom mirror. Any taller and you will find yourself looking into a cabinet, not a mirror. That is, of course, if you manage to get enough water flowing out of the sink, or shower, to actually manage to wash. The hotel looks cool from the common areas and is a joke when it comes to basic utlities in the rooms. It is great to be in a cool hotel, but not when it is falling apart. Additionally, the bar and the restaurant were lame. In my 5 day stay I never saw a crowd or any semblance of what could be described as a scene. Save your money and stay somewhere else. This is no luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in March (it is now called the Dylan) 2 nights in a superior room with canal view and last night in a duplex suite with canal view. The staff were excellent, they knew our names and were friendly and helpful. Really enjoyed the fusion food in the restaurant. The breakfast was good as well, although a little annoying when you pay an inclusive room rate and find this only covers the basic continental breakfast and all fruit, yoghurt, eggs etc are payable extra. The rooms were a little disappointing, I have to agree with one of the previous reviewers that they tended towards design over practicality. The design is quite stark, rather than romantic. Having said that, the beds were very comfortable and the baths huge. We had problems with our shower, hence our upgrade to the duplex suite for the final night. The bed in the suite was one of the most comfortable I've slept on with superb bed linen. There were DVD and CD players in both rooms. The location was very good, within walking distance of all major attractions, but away from the noisy areas like Dam square. I would recommend this hotel, especially when the new spa facilities are built.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mangement and the name just changed January 1st 2005 to the Dylan. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. Concierge made the stay so much better by providing wonderful dining recommendations. Hotel dining room is best in the city.

Reviews.Title: “amazing service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment i checked in i knew this hotel was special. I was greeted with champagne and a pleasant staff willing to accomodate me even though i had no reservation. The room was amazing. Max, the conceirge, thought of everything including giving me an umbrella for rain was in the forecast. The hotel thought of everything so that I wouldnt have to. The service is amazing even if some of the design is a case of form over function.

HotelInfo.Name: The Dylan
HotelInfo.Address: Keizersgracht 384, Amsterdam 1016 GB, The Netherlands
